title: MySQLFORMAT()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLFORMAT()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Format the number as "#,###,###.##" (and round with two decimal places):
SELECT FORMAT(250500.5634, 2);

Definition and Usage
The FORMAT() function formats a number to a format like "#,###,###.##", rounded to a 
specified number 
of decimal places, then it returns the result as a string.
Syntax
FORMAT(
number
,
decimal_places
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. The number to be formatted
decimal_places
Required. The number of decimal places for
number.
If this 
    parameter is 0, this function returns a string 
  with no decimal places
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Format the number as a format of "#,###,###.##" (and round with 0 decimal places):
SELECT FORMAT(250500.5634, 0);
